result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron B Reigle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs, including mandatory ponography and DNA surcharge.  If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  **NOTE: $1,000.00 bond has been applied toward the court costs, leaving a balance due of $18.00.**
------------------------------

No contact with minors unless granted under discretion of Supervising Agent
---------------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

records.addlTxt: Supplemental - Ex #1 DVD

IT IS ORDERED that on or before June 13, 2018, the clerk of the circuit court shall transmit the DVD represented by photocopy as record item No. 19, as a supplement to the record on appeal.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the DVD shall be filed in this court under seal.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that counsel for the State and for the appellant are permitted to access and reference the DVD in a manner consistent with this order.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the time for the State to file the respondent's brief is extended to thirty days after the DVD is filed under seal in this court.

Transmittal of record to court of appeals

records.addlTxt: with Index attached

Motion Hearing before the Honorable David Reddy on February 5, 2018
Court Reporter Sandy Elderbrook
Original filed with court.

Sentencing Hearing before the Honorable David Reddy on January 19, 2018
Court Reporter Adrianne Adams
Original Order to Produce filed with Court.

Defendant Aaron B Reigle in court, in custody with attorney Jerome F Buting.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court in session @ 4:17 pm. Appearances made. Matter before the Court on Defendant's Motion for Relief Pending Appeal. Court makes record as to State vs. Salmon and has reviewed all the briefs submitted by the parties. Court goes over factors.
#1 - No substantial risk that defendant will not appear - weighs in favor of defendant
#2 - Not likely to commit serious crime/intimidate witnesses - weighs in favor of defendant
#3 - Prompt execution of post conviction - non factor
#4 - Post conviction proceeding not taken for purposes of delay - Court makes record as to this factor as well as length of sentence and other factors addressed in cited case.
Court addresses likelihood of success on appeal as a major factor in Salmon, makes record, and finds that defendant is not likely to succeed on the merits of appeal and justification for bail pending appeal is not appropriate. Based upon Court's record/findings and denies the motion.
4:23 p.m. - Response/record by Atty. Buting that he has no questions, and is planning on filing brief and if Court of Appeals finds merit to the appeal, he would like to bring this back before the Court.
Atty. Buting to prepare order.
Court in recess @ 4:24 p.m.

  Review scheduled for February 16, 2018.

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 2-19-18: COURT REPORTER SANDY ELDERBROOK**
State's Brief on Def's Motion for Bond Pending Appeal
Deft Cover Letter  in re: Order to Produce Defendant
Notice of Appeal and Circuit Court Record has been received by the COA
Appeals Document Index saved for: 2018AP000153 by: Margo Grabner
Adjustment Number: 18A 027460, Payable Number: 215028, Receipt Number: 18R 001818, Amount: $15.00
JOC entered on 01-19-2018
Copy of Clerk's Letter to State Public Defender in response to Notice of Intent to Pursue Post Conviction Relief
Temporary Commitment form filed
Motion to Reinstate Bail Pending Appeal & To Stay Execution of Judgment
Plea entered on October 11, 2017 and sentencing on January 19 2018
records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Aaron B Reigle in court with attorney Jerome F Buting.  Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 9:03 a.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for sentencing hearing. State has complied with victim's rights and agrees that no restitution to be ordered. Record by Court as to agreement of the parties of 3 years IC and 3 years of ES. Parties agree that this the agreement and Atty. Buting has no objection to the conditions as requested by the State.
9:05 a.m. - Record/argument by Atty. Buting
9:07 a.m. - Defendant reads statement to the Court.
9:09 a.m. - Record by the Court as to sentencing factors, mandatory minimum, and severity of charges. Court adopts agreement of parties and pronounces sentence. Court gives firearms warning to the defendant, voting rights.  Defendent  is not eligible for programming. 
9:11 a.m. - Record by Atty Buting as to appeal regarding motion to suppress that he is intending to appeal and requests bond be extended until appeal on this issue is resolved. Appeal should be ready to file by next week. Response by the State that they are not prepared to argue this motion and would be objecting. Court goes off the record to address scheduling. 
9:17 a.m. - Back on the record. Atty. Buting will be filing motion today. State has until February 2, 2018 for response and matter is scheduled. Court also makes record as to discussions had off the record. 
SENTENCE - 
Three (3) years of Initial Confinement followed by three (3) years of Extended Supervision for a total of six (6) years
One (1) day deadtime credit
Pay costs including $500 child pornography surcharge
Submit DNA sample/pay surcharge
No contact with minors unless granted under discretion of Supervising Agent

Defendant taken into custody. Parties have nothing further. Court in recess @ 9:21 a.m.  Motion hearing scheduled for February 5, 2018 at 04:00 pm.

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 2-8-18: COURT REPORTER ADRIANNE ADAMS**
Defense Sentencing Letters

Excerpt of Proceedings of Motion Hearing on February 23, 2009 before the Honorable John Race in case # 05FA601
Court Reporter Linda Matoska

Defendant Aaron B Reigle in court with attorney Jerome F Buting.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 3:33 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for final pretrial, but the defendant is entering a plea today. Record by Atty. Buting as to agreement. Defendant is agreeing to State's recommendation of 3 yrs IC and 3 yrs ES and is accepting that. Atty. Buting makes record as to request for separate sentencing date to allow defendant to move back here as he lives in Nevada and needs to get his matters in order before prison sentence begins. No objection by the State.
3:37 p.m. - State is not considering this victim crime as there is no identifiable victims. There will be no restitution request. Court goes over plea questionnaire/elements of the crime being plead to. 
Court goes over deportation and firearm warnings.

Defendant pleads GUILTY to Count #2
Count #1 is dismissed and read-in. 
Discussion as to sentencing date. Matter set over for sentencing. Parties have nothing further.
Court in recess @ 3:43 p.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2018 at 09:00 am.

State's Brief in Support of Motion to Introduce Other Acts Evidence

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
IT IS ORDERED that the motion is denied.  The 30-day period in which to file a petition for review may not be enlarged.  
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED the motion itself should be deemed to be a timely but noconforming petition for review.  However, a statement in support of the petition, conforming to the requirements of Wis. Stat. 809.62(2) and (4), must be filed with the clerk of this court by December 7, 2016.  If the statement is not filed by that time, this petition will be summarily dismissed.  No further extensions will be granted.

records.addlTxt: Notification of Filing of Order Granting Leave to Appeal and Circuit Court Record (Docket Entries)
August 20, 2015 order

IT IS ORDERED that the petition for leave to appeal is granted, without costs.  The entry of this order has the effect of the filing of a notice of appeal.  WIS. STAT. RULE 809.50(3). A copy of this order had been forwarded to the clerk of the circuit court.  Pursuant to RULE 809.11(2), the clerk of the circuit court or responsible court official shall return the copy of the order granting this petition and the docket entries maintained pursuant to WIS. STAT. 59.40, to the clerk of this court within three days of receipt of the order.

Transcript of Final Pretrial before the Hon. David M. Reddy on August 19, 2015
Court Reporter:  Eileen Walsh Grzenia
Acknowledgement of Filing of Writ/ Petition
Status conference at 10-09-2015 01:15 pm
Order finding that the three year minimum prison sentence applies in this case

Defendant Aaron B Reigle in court with attorneys Jerome Buting and Larry D. Steen.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for Final pre-trial and comes before the Court on the Defendant's Motion to make a determination as to whether Sec. 939.167 requires a minimum 3 year prison term in this case.  Court makes record.  The Court has reviewed the Motion and Briefs submitted by the parties.  Discussion between Court and Attorneys.  Argument by Attorneys.  Court finds that the 3 years is the minimum mandatory in effect for this case.  Attorney Buting asks Court to reschedule the trial currently set for Monday and Tuesday of next week and makes a record as to his reasons for this request.  Attorney Rea is prepared to proceed to trial.  Court is inclined to keep this matter on for trial and allow Atttorney Buting time to speak with his client.  Court asks that Jury Instructions be filed by noon on Friday.  Court sets this for a status hearing on the 1:15 Call on Friday.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
